Appendix

Appendix A Main proofs

A.1 Proof of PropositionÂ 1

See 1

Proof.

We first need to restrict the dynamics of (wÎ»â¢(t))superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡(w^{\lambda}(t))( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) to some compact of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Without loss of generality we can inflate the compact in AssumptionÂ 1, so that we can assume there is some compact Kğ¾Kitalic_K of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for all tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0italic_t â‰¥ 0, Bâ¢(wGFâ¢(t),1)âŠ‚Kğµsuperscriptğ‘¤GFğ‘¡1ğ¾B(w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t),1)\subset Kitalic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , 1 ) âŠ‚ italic_K, where Bâ¢(wGFâ¢(t),1)ğµsuperscriptğ‘¤GFğ‘¡1B(w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t),1)italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , 1 ) is the ball of radius 1111 centered at wGFâ¢(t)superscriptğ‘¤GFğ‘¡w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ). We also define for any Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0, TÎ»=inf{tâˆˆâ„+âˆ£wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ‰K}subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†infimumconditional-setğ‘¡subscriptâ„superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ¾T_{\lambda}=\inf\{t\in\mathbb{R}_{+}\mid w^{\lambda}(t)\not\in K\}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_inf { italic_t âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ£ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ‰ italic_K }.

Thanks to the continuity of âˆ‡2Fsuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ¹\nabla^{2}Fâˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F, âˆ‡Fâˆ‡ğ¹\nabla Fâˆ‡ italic_F is cğ‘citalic_c-Lipschitz on Kğ¾Kitalic_K, i.e.,

â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(w)âˆ’âˆ‡Fâ¢(wâ€²)â€–â‰¤câ¢â€–wâˆ’wâ€²â€–for anyÂ â¢w,wâ€²âˆˆK.formulae-sequencenormâˆ‡ğ¹ğ‘¤âˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤â€²ğ‘normğ‘¤superscriptğ‘¤â€²for anyÂ ğ‘¤superscriptğ‘¤â€²ğ¾\|\nabla F(w)-\nabla F(w^{\prime})\|\leq c\|w-w^{\prime}\|\qquad\text{for any % }w,w^{\prime}\in K.âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w ) - âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ â‰¤ italic_c âˆ¥ italic_w - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ for any italic_w , italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_K .

We then derive the following inequalities for all tâˆˆ[0,TÎ»)ğ‘¡0subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†t\in[0,T_{\lambda})italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ),

â€–wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡\displaystyle\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ =â€–âˆ«0twË™Î»â¢(s)âˆ’wË™Gâ¢Fâ¢(s)â¢dâ¢sâ€–absentnormsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡superscriptË™ğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ superscriptË™ğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘ dğ‘ \displaystyle=\left\|\int_{0}^{t}\dot{w}^{\lambda}(s)-\dot{w}^{GF}(s)\mathrm{d% }s\right\|= âˆ¥ âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT overË™ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) - overË™ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) roman_d italic_s âˆ¥
=â€–âˆ«0tâˆ‡Fâ¢(wGâ¢Fâ¢(s))âˆ’âˆ‡Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(s))âˆ’Î»â¢wÎ»â¢(s)â¢dâ¢sâ€–absentnormsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘ âˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ dğ‘ \displaystyle=\left\|\int_{0}^{t}\nabla F(w^{GF}(s))-\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(s))-% \lambda w^{\lambda}(s)\mathrm{d}s\right\|= âˆ¥ âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - italic_Î» italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) roman_d italic_s âˆ¥
â‰¤âˆ«0tâ€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(wGâ¢Fâ¢(s))âˆ’âˆ‡Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(s))â€–â¢ds+Î»â¢âˆ«0tâ€–wÎ»â¢(s)â€–â¢dsabsentsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡normâˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘ âˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ differential-dğ‘ ğœ†superscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ differential-dğ‘ \displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{t}\left\|\nabla F(w^{GF}(s))-\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(s% ))\right\|\mathrm{d}s+\lambda\int_{0}^{t}\|w^{\lambda}(s)\|\mathrm{d}sâ‰¤ âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) âˆ¥ roman_d italic_s + italic_Î» âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) âˆ¥ roman_d italic_s
â‰¤câ¢âˆ«0tâ€–wÎ»â¢(s)âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(s)â€–â¢ds+Î»â¢tâ¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–.absentğ‘superscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘ differential-dğ‘ ğœ†ğ‘¡subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤\displaystyle\leq c\int_{0}^{t}\left\|w^{\lambda}(s)-w^{GF}(s)\right\|\mathrm{% d}s+\lambda t\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|.â‰¤ italic_c âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) âˆ¥ roman_d italic_s + italic_Î» italic_t roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥ .

The integral form of GrÃ¶nwall inequality111The more classical form of GrÃ¶nwall inequality cannot be directly used here, since â€–wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ might be non-differentiable at some points. â€“ also called GrÃ¶nwall-Bellman inequality â€“ then leads to the following inequality for any tâˆˆ[0,TÎ»)ğ‘¡0subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†t\in[0,T_{\lambda})italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ):

â€–wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–â‰¤Î»â¢tâ¢ecâ¢tâ¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–.normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘¡subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|\leq\lambda te^{ct}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|.âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ â‰¤ italic_Î» italic_t italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥ . (9)

In particular for a fixed Tâˆˆâ„+ğ‘‡subscriptâ„T\in\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_T âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, there is a Î»â‹†>0superscriptğœ†â‹†0\lambda^{\star}>0italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 small enough such that for any Î»â‰¤Î»â‹†ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» â‰¤ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT,

âˆ€tâˆˆ[0,T],Î»â¢tâ¢ecâ¢tâ¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–<1.formulae-sequencefor-allğ‘¡0ğ‘‡ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘¡subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤1\forall t\in[0,T],\lambda te^{ct}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|<1.âˆ€ italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , italic_T ] , italic_Î» italic_t italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥ < 1 .

Given the definition of TÎ»subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†T_{\lambda}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, EquationÂ 9 and the fact that â‹ƒtâˆˆâ„+Bâ¢(wGFâ¢(t),1)âŠ‚Ksubscriptğ‘¡subscriptâ„ğµsuperscriptğ‘¤GFğ‘¡1ğ¾\bigcup_{t\in\mathbb{R}_{+}}B(w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t),1)\subset Kâ‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , 1 ) âŠ‚ italic_K, this then implies that for any Î»â‰¤Î»â‹†ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» â‰¤ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, TÎ»>Tsubscriptğ‘‡ğœ†ğ‘‡T_{\lambda}>Titalic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_T. In particular, for any Î»â‰¤Î»â‹†ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» â‰¤ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, EquationÂ 9 becomes

suptâˆˆ[0,T]â€–wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–â‰¤Î»â¢Tâ¢ecâ¢Tâ¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–.subscriptsupremumğ‘¡0ğ‘‡normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡ğœ†ğ‘‡superscriptğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘‡subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤\sup_{t\in[0,T]}\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|\leq\lambda Te^{cT}\sup% _{w\in K}\|w\|.roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ â‰¤ italic_Î» italic_T italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥ .

PropositionÂ 1 then directly follows. âˆ

A.2 Junction between fast and slow dynamics

In the limit Î»â†’0â†’ğœ†0\lambda\to 0italic_Î» â†’ 0, the whole fast dynamics described by PropositionÂ 1 is crushed into the t=0ğ‘¡0t=0italic_t = 0 point of the slow timescale. While SectionsÂ 4.1 andÂ 4.2 respectively provide descriptions of the fast and slow timescale dynamics, one needs to control the junction of these two dynamics. This junction is made possible by LemmaÂ 2 below, as well as a timeshift argument in the proof of PropositionÂ 2.

Lemma 2.

If AssumptionÂ 1 holds, there exists a function tâ¢(Î»)ğ‘¡ğœ†t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_Î» ) such that limÎ»â†’0tâ¢(Î»)=0subscriptâ†’ğœ†0ğ‘¡ğœ†0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}t(\lambda)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ( italic_Î» ) = 0 and

limÎ»â†’0w~Î»â¢(tâ¢(Î»))=limtâ†’âˆwGFâ¢(t).subscriptâ†’ğœ†0superscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤GFğ‘¡\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t(\lambda))=\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\mathrm% {GF}}(t).roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ( italic_Î» ) ) = roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) .

LemmaÂ 2 states that for a well chosen timepoint tâ¢(Î»)ğ‘¡ğœ†t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_Î» ), which is of order âˆ’Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»)ğœ†ğœ†-\lambda\ln(\lambda)- italic_Î» roman_ln ( italic_Î» ), the slow dynamics solution w~Î»superscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†\tilde{w}^{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT will be close to the limit of the unregularised flow at that timepoint. This result will then be key in showing that limÎ»â†’0w~Î»subscriptâ†’ğœ†0superscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\tilde{w}^{\lambda}roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT admits a right limit in 00, which is given by limtâ†’âˆwGFâ¢(t)subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤GFğ‘¡\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ).

Note that this order âˆ’Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»)ğœ†ğœ†-\lambda\ln(\lambda)- italic_Î» roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) for tâ¢(Î»)ğ‘¡ğœ†t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_Î» ) is necessary: a smaller value of tâ¢(Î»)ğ‘¡ğœ†t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_Î» ) would not allow enough time for the flow to approach the limit of the unregularised gradient flow; while a larger value would correspond to a time where the regularised flow significantly drifted from the unregularised one.

This time âˆ’Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»)ğœ†ğœ†-\lambda\ln(\lambda)- italic_Î» roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) can indeed be seen, in the fast timescale, as the point where the dynamics transition from mimicking the unregularised flow, to the slow dynamics that minimises the regularisation term within some manifold.

Proof.

EquationÂ 9 in the proof of PropositionÂ 1 yields that for any tâˆˆ[0,TÎ»]ğ‘¡0subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†t\in[0,T_{\lambda}]italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], â€–wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–â‰¤Î»â¢tâ¢ecâ¢tâ¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘¡subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|\leq\lambda te^{ct}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ â‰¤ italic_Î» italic_t italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥. We can then define tâ¢(Î»)=âˆ’Î»â¢lnâ¡Î»2â¢c>0ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†2ğ‘0t(\lambda)=\frac{-\lambda\ln\lambda}{2c}>0italic_t ( italic_Î» ) = divide start_ARG - italic_Î» roman_ln italic_Î» end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG > 0 and observe that for any tâ‰¤minâ¡(TÎ»,tâ¢(Î»)Î»)ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†t\leq\min(T_{\lambda},\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})italic_t â‰¤ roman_min ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ),

â€–wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡\displaystyle\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\|âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ â‰¤tâ¢(Î»)â¢ecâ¢tâ¢(Î»)Î»â¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–absentğ‘¡ğœ†superscriptğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤\displaystyle\leq t(\lambda)e^{c\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|â‰¤ italic_t ( italic_Î» ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥
=âˆ’Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»)2â¢câ¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–.absentğœ†ğœ†2ğ‘subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤\displaystyle=\frac{-\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)}{2c}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|.= divide start_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥ .

Since Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»)â¢âŸ¶Î»â†’0â¢0ğœ†ğœ†â†’ğœ†0âŸ¶0\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)\underset{\lambda\to 0}{\longrightarrow}0square-root start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) start_UNDERACCENT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG âŸ¶ end_ARG 0, we have for Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î» small enough that the above term is smaller than 1111. In particular for Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î» small enough, TÎ»â‰¥tâ¢(Î»)Î»subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†T_{\lambda}\geq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG. From there, EquationÂ 9 yields at tâ¢(Î»)Î»ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG for any small enough Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0

â€–w~Î»â¢(tâ¢(Î»))âˆ’limtâ†’âˆwGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–normsuperscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡\displaystyle\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t(\lambda))-\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{GF}(t)\|âˆ¥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ( italic_Î» ) ) - roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ â‰¤â€–w~Î»â¢(tâ¢(Î»))âˆ’wGâ¢Fâ¢(tâ¢(Î»)Î»)â€–+â€–wGâ¢Fâ¢(tâ¢(Î»)Î»)âˆ’limtâ†’âˆwGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–absentnormsuperscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t(\lambda))-w^{GF}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{% \lambda})\|+\|w^{GF}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})-\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{GF}(t)\|â‰¤ âˆ¥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ( italic_Î» ) ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) âˆ¥ + âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) - roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥
â‰¤âˆ’Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»)2â¢câ¢supwâˆˆKâ€–wâ€–+â€–wGâ¢Fâ¢(tâ¢(Î»)Î»)âˆ’limtâ†’âˆwGâ¢Fâ¢(t)â€–.absentğœ†ğœ†2ğ‘subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾normğ‘¤normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğºğ¹ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\frac{-\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)}{2c}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|+\|w^% {GF}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})-\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{GF}(t)\|.â‰¤ divide start_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥ + âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) - roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ .

Now note that our choice of tâ¢(Î»)ğ‘¡ğœ†t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_Î» ) is such that both the first and second term in the last inequality converge to 00 â€” indeed, tâ¢(Î»)â¢ecâ¢tâ¢(Î»)Î»=âˆ’Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»)2â¢câ¢âŸ¶Î»â†’0â¢0ğ‘¡ğœ†superscriptğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†2ğ‘â†’ğœ†0âŸ¶0t(\lambda)e^{c\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}=\frac{-\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)}{2% c}\underset{\lambda\to 0}{\longrightarrow}0italic_t ( italic_Î» ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG start_UNDERACCENT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG âŸ¶ end_ARG 0 and tâ¢(Î»)Î»â¢âŸ¶Î»â†’0+âˆğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†â†’ğœ†0âŸ¶\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}\underset{\lambda\to 0}{\longrightarrow}+\inftydivide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG start_UNDERACCENT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG âŸ¶ end_ARG + âˆ â€” which concludes the proof. âˆ

A.3 Proof of PropositionÂ 2

The main element to prove PropositionÂ 2 is LemmaÂ 4 below. We first need to state another auxiliary lemma, given by LemmaÂ 3 below, and proven in SectionÂ B.5.

Lemma 3.

Consider AssumptionsÂ 1 andÂ 2. Let (uÎ»)Î»>0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğœ†0(u^{\lambda})_{\lambda>0}( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a family of solutions of the following ODE for any Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0 and tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0italic_t â‰¥ 0,

uË™Î»â¢(t)=âˆ’uÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’1Î»â¢âˆ‡Fâ¢(uÎ»â¢(t)).superscriptË™ğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡1ğœ†âˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡\dot{u}^{\lambda}(t)=-u^{\lambda}(t)-\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F(u^{\lambda}(t)).overË™ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = - italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) .

    â‹‚Îµ>0UÎµ=â„³subscriptğœ€0subscriptğ‘ˆğœ€â„³\bigcap_{\varepsilon>0}U_{\varepsilon}=\mathcal{M}â‹‚ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_M.

Note that the existence of a neighbourhood Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U in LemmaÂ 3 is guaranteed by LemmaÂ 1. We can now state our key lemma.

Lemma 4.

In consequence, we have222This is a direct consequence of Taylorâ€™s expansion taken at the euclidean projection of wğ‘¤witalic_w on â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and the fact that limÎ»â†’0Îµâ¢(Î»)=0subscriptâ†’ğœ†0ğœ€ğœ†0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\varepsilon(\lambda)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ ( italic_Î» ) = 0. supwâˆˆKâˆ©UÎµâ¢(Î»)â€–Î¦â¢(w)âˆ’wâ€–2â¢âŸ¶Î»â†’0â¢0subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğ¾subscriptğ‘ˆğœ€ğœ†subscriptnormÎ¦ğ‘¤ğ‘¤2â†’ğœ†0âŸ¶0\sup_{w\in K\cap U_{\varepsilon(\lambda)}}\|\Phi(w)-w\|_{2}\underset{\lambda% \to 0}{\longrightarrow}0roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_K âˆ© italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ ( italic_Î» ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ ( italic_w ) - italic_w âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG âŸ¶ end_ARG 0.

Summing over EquationÂ 10 yields for any tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0italic_t â‰¥ 0:

uÎ»â¢(t)=âˆ«0tHâ¢(uÎ»â¢(s))â¢ds+uÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’Î¦â¢(uÎ»â¢(t))+Î¦â¢(uÎ»â¢(0)).superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡ğ»superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘ differential-dğ‘ superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡Î¦superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡Î¦superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†0\displaystyle u^{\lambda}(t)=\int_{0}^{t}H(u^{\lambda}(s))\mathrm{d}s+u^{% \lambda}(t)-\Phi(u^{\lambda}(t))+\Phi(u^{\lambda}(0)).italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) roman_d italic_s + italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - roman_Î¦ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) + roman_Î¦ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) .

Proof.

with an initial condition satisfying limÎ»â†’0v~Î»â¢(0)=Î¦â¢(w0)subscriptâ†’ğœ†0superscript~ğ‘£ğœ†0Î¦subscriptğ‘¤0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(0)=\Phi(w_{0})roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) = roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

â€–w~Î»â¢(t)âˆ’w~âˆ˜â¢(t)â€–normsuperscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscript~ğ‘¤ğ‘¡\displaystyle\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t)-\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)\|âˆ¥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ =â€–v~Î»â¢(tâˆ’tâ¢(Î»))âˆ’w~âˆ˜â¢(t)â€–absentnormsuperscript~ğ‘£ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†superscript~ğ‘¤ğ‘¡\displaystyle=\|\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(t-t(\lambda))-\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)\|= âˆ¥ over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - italic_t ( italic_Î» ) ) - over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥

A.4 Proof of PropositionÂ 3

See 3

Proof.

By definition [see e.g., Bergmann and Herzog, 2019], the KKT points of EquationÂ 7 are the points wâ‹†âˆˆâ„³superscriptğ‘¤â‹†â„³w^{\star}\in\mathcal{M}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_M satisfying

gradâ„³â¢â„“2â¢(wâ‹†)=0.subscriptgradâ„³subscriptâ„“2superscriptğ‘¤â‹†0\mathrm{grad}_{\mathcal{M}}\ell_{2}(w^{\star})=0.roman_grad start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = 0 .

Since gradâ„³â¢â„“2=PKerâ¢(âˆ‡2Fâ¢(wâ‹†))subscriptgradâ„³subscriptâ„“2subscriptğ‘ƒKersuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤â‹†\mathrm{grad}_{\mathcal{M}}\ell_{2}=P_{\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star}))}roman_grad start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ker ( âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, KKT points of EquationÂ 7 are the points wâ‹†âˆˆâ„³superscriptğ‘¤â‹†â„³w^{\star}\in\mathcal{M}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_M satisfying

wâ‹†âˆˆKerâ¢(âˆ‡2Fâ¢(wâ‹†))âŸ‚.superscriptğ‘¤â‹†Kersuperscriptsuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤â‹†perpendicular-tow^{\star}\in\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star}))^{\perp}.italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ roman_Ker ( âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ‚ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (12)

Thanks to LemmaÂ 7, the trajectories (wÎ»â¢(t))tâ‰¥0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ‘¡0(w^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â‰¥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are all bounded and wâˆÎ»â‰”limtâ†’âˆwÎ»â¢(t)â‰”subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡w^{\lambda}_{\infty}\coloneqq\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰” roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) exists for any Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0. Let wâ‹†superscriptğ‘¤â‹†w^{\star}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be an adherence point of the sequence (wâˆÎ»k)ksubscriptsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜ğ‘˜(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty})_{k}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thanks to LemmaÂ 3, wâ‹†âˆˆâ„³superscriptğ‘¤â‹†â„³w^{\star}\in\mathcal{M}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_M. Rebjock and Boumal [2024, Proposition 2.8] then also implies that

dâ¢(wâˆÎ»k,â„³)=ğ’ªâ¢(Î»k).ğ‘‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜â„³ğ’ªsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜d(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty},\mathcal{M})=\mathcal{O}\left(\lambda_{k}\right).italic_d ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_M ) = caligraphic_O ( italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Moreover, noting wk=argâ¢minwâˆˆâ„³â¢â€–wâˆÎ»kâˆ’wâ€–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘˜argsubscriptminğ‘¤â„³normsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜ğ‘¤w_{k}=\mathrm{arg\ min\ }_{w\in\mathcal{M}}\|w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}-w\|italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w âˆ¥ the projection of wâˆÎ»ksubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT onto â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M, a Taylor expansion yields

âˆ’âˆ‡2Fâ¢(wâ‹†)âŠ¤â¢uâˆ=wâ‹†.superscriptâˆ‡2ğ¹superscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤â‹†topsubscriptğ‘¢superscriptğ‘¤â‹†-\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star})^{\top}u_{\infty}=w^{\star}.- âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

A.5 Proof of PropositionÂ 4

See 4

Proof.

For this proof, denote wâ‹†=limtâ†’âˆw~âˆ˜â¢(t)superscriptğ‘¤â‹†subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscript~ğ‘¤ğ‘¡w^{\star}=\lim_{t\to\infty}\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) and Fâ‹†=Fâ¢(wâ‹†)superscriptğ¹â‹†ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤â‹†F^{\star}=F(w^{\star})italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). wâ‹†superscriptğ‘¤â‹†w^{\star}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a strict local minimum of the Euclidean norm on â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M. Moreover using the Morse Bott property [AssumptionÂ 2 and see Rebjock and Boumal, 2024], we can consider an arbitrarily small Î´>0ğ›¿0\delta>0italic_Î´ > 0 such that the following conditions simultaneously hold in Bâ¢(0,Î´)ğµ0ğ›¿B(0,\delta)italic_B ( 0 , italic_Î´ ) for some Î²>0ğ›½0\beta>0italic_Î² > 0:

âˆ€wâˆˆBâ¢(0,Î´),Î²â¢(Fâ¢(w)âˆ’Fâ‹†)â‰¥â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(w)â€–22â‰¥Î·â¢(Fâ¢(w)âˆ’Fâ‹†).formulae-sequencefor-allğ‘¤ğµ0ğ›¿ğ›½ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†superscriptsubscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹ğ‘¤22ğœ‚ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†\displaystyle\forall w\in B(0,\delta),\beta(F(w)-F^{\star})\geq\|\nabla F(w)\|% _{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w)-F^{\star}).âˆ€ italic_w âˆˆ italic_B ( 0 , italic_Î´ ) , italic_Î² ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¥ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î· ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

By pointwise convergence of w~Î»â¢(t0)superscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†subscriptğ‘¡0\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t_{0})over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) to w~âˆ˜â¢(t0)superscript~ğ‘¤subscriptğ‘¡0\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t_{0})over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), we then have that for Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0 small enough, â€–w~Î»â¢(t0)âˆ’wâ‹†â€–â‰¤Î´â€²2normsuperscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†subscriptğ‘¡0superscriptğ‘¤â‹†superscriptğ›¿â€²2\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t_{0})-w^{\star}\|\leq\frac{\delta^{\prime}}{2}âˆ¥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG. (16)

From there, we define for this proof TÎ»=inf{tâ‰¥t0âˆ£w~Î»â¢(t)âˆ‰Bâ¢(wâ‹†,Î´â€²)}subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†infimumconditional-setğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¡0superscript~ğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğµsuperscriptğ‘¤â‹†superscriptğ›¿â€²T_{\lambda}=\inf\{t\geq t_{0}\mid\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t)\not\in B(w^{\star},% \delta^{\prime})\}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_inf { italic_t â‰¥ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ£ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ‰ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) }. From there, by monotonicity of the loss, for any tâ‰¥tâ€²ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¡â€²t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t â‰¥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT:

By continuity, EquationÂ 15 then implies that for any tâ‰¥tâ€²ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¡â€²t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t â‰¥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, wÎ»â¢(t)âˆˆBâ¢(wâ‹†,Î´)superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğµsuperscriptğ‘¤â‹†ğ›¿w^{\lambda}(t)\in B(w^{\star},\delta)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆˆ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Î´ ).

To summarise, we have shown that for any small enough Î´>0ğ›¿0\delta>0italic_Î´ > 0, there exists Î»â‹†â¢(Î´)superscriptğœ†â‹†ğ›¿\lambda^{\star}(\delta)italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ ) and tâ€²â¢(Î»,Î´)superscriptğ‘¡â€²ğœ†ğ›¿t^{\prime}(\lambda,\delta)italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Î» , italic_Î´ ) such that for any Î»â‰¤Î»â‹†â¢(Î´)ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†ğ›¿\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}(\delta)italic_Î» â‰¤ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ ), limtâ†’âˆwÎ»â¢(t)âˆˆBâ¢(wâ‹†,Î´)subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğµsuperscriptğ‘¤â‹†ğ›¿\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)\in B(w^{\star},\delta)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆˆ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Î´ ).

This means that limÎ»â†’0limtâ†’âˆwÎ»â¢(t)=wâ‹†subscriptâ†’ğœ†0subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤â‹†\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)=w^{\star}roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which proves PropositionÂ 4. âˆ

Appendix B Auxiliary proofs

B.1 Proof of LemmaÂ 1

See 1

Proof.

First, we restrict ourselves to a bounded open set BğµBitalic_B of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and consider Ï•â¢(â‹…,t)italic-Ï•â‹…ğ‘¡\phi(\cdot,t)italic_Ï• ( â‹… , italic_t ) as a function Bâ†’â„dâ†’ğµsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘B\to\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_B â†’ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for any tğ‘¡titalic_t.

The main point of the proof is to show that â„³âˆ©Bâ„³ğµ\mathcal{M}\cap Bcaligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B is geometrically stable in the sense of Falconer [1983], i.e., that there exists a neighbourhood (in BğµBitalic_B) Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U of â„³âˆ©Bâ„³ğµ\mathcal{M}\cap Bcaligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B, s>0ğ‘ 0s>0italic_s > 0 and k<1ğ‘˜1k<1italic_k < 1 such that for any uâˆˆUğ‘¢ğ‘ˆu\in Uitalic_u âˆˆ italic_U and tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0italic_t â‰¥ 0,

dâ¢(Ï•â¢(w,t+s),â„³âˆ©B)â‰¤kâ¢dâ¢(Ï•â¢(w,t),â„³âˆ©B),ğ‘‘italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘ â„³ğµğ‘˜ğ‘‘italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡â„³ğµd(\phi(w,t+s),\mathcal{M}\cap B)\leq kd(\phi(w,t),\mathcal{M}\cap B),italic_d ( italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t + italic_s ) , caligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B ) â‰¤ italic_k italic_d ( italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t ) , caligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B ) ,

where dâ¢(v,â„³)=infxâˆˆâ„³â€–vâˆ’xâ€–2ğ‘‘ğ‘£â„³subscriptinfimumğ‘¥â„³subscriptnormğ‘£ğ‘¥2d(v,\mathcal{M})=\inf_{x\in\mathcal{M}}\|v-x\|_{2}italic_d ( italic_v , caligraphic_M ) = roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x âˆˆ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_v - italic_x âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.333The definition of Falconer [1983] is stated differently but a consequence of ours, by defining the open set W={Ï•â¢(w,t)âˆ£wâˆˆU,tâ‰¥0}ğ‘Šconditional-setitalic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡formulae-sequenceğ‘¤ğ‘ˆğ‘¡0W=\{\phi(w,t)\mid w\in U,t\geq 0\}italic_W = { italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t ) âˆ£ italic_w âˆˆ italic_U , italic_t â‰¥ 0 } and fâ¢(w)=Ï•â¢(w,s)ğ‘“ğ‘¤italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘ f(w)=\phi(w,s)italic_f ( italic_w ) = italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_s ).

Let xâˆˆâ„³âˆ©Bğ‘¥â„³ğµx\in\mathcal{M}\cap Bitalic_x âˆˆ caligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B. The Morse-Bott property (AssumptionÂ 2) implies that there exists a neighbourhood Uâ¢(x)âŠ‚Bğ‘ˆğ‘¥ğµU(x)\subset Bitalic_U ( italic_x ) âŠ‚ italic_B of xğ‘¥xitalic_x, such that Fğ¹Fitalic_F satisfies the Polyak-Åojasiewicz (PL) inequality with constant Î·2ğœ‚2\frac{\eta}{2}divide start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG, thanks to the equivalences between both conditions [Rebjock and Boumal, 2024]

â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(w)â€–22â‰¥Î·â¢(Fâ¢(w)âˆ’Fâ¢(x))âˆ€wâˆˆUâ¢(x).formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹ğ‘¤22ğœ‚ğ¹ğ‘¤ğ¹ğ‘¥for-allğ‘¤ğ‘ˆğ‘¥\|\nabla F(w)\|_{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w)-F(x))\quad\forall w\in U(x).âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î· ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F ( italic_x ) ) âˆ€ italic_w âˆˆ italic_U ( italic_x ) . (17)

In the following, we define Fâ‹†=Fâ¢(x)superscriptğ¹â‹†ğ¹ğ‘¥F^{\star}=F(x)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_x ), which is the value of Fğ¹Fitalic_F on the manifold â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M (the definition does not depend on the choice of xğ‘¥xitalic_x).

In particular, there is some Î´0â¢(x)>0subscriptğ›¿0ğ‘¥0\delta_{0}(x)>0italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) > 0 such that Bâ¢(x,Î´0â¢(x))âŠ‚Uâ¢(x)ğµğ‘¥subscriptğ›¿0ğ‘¥ğ‘ˆğ‘¥B(x,\delta_{0}(x))\subset U(x)italic_B ( italic_x , italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) ) âŠ‚ italic_U ( italic_x ). Thanks to Rebjock and Boumal [2024, Propositions 2.3 and 2.8, Remark 2.10], we can even choose Î´0â¢(x)subscriptğ›¿0ğ‘¥\delta_{0}(x)italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) small enough so that there are some Î±,Î²ğ›¼ğ›½\alpha,\betaitalic_Î± , italic_Î² such that

â‰¤8â¢Î±Î·â¢eâˆ’Î·â¢tâ¢dâ¢(w,â„³âˆ©B)2.absent8ğ›¼ğœ‚superscriptğ‘’ğœ‚ğ‘¡ğ‘‘superscriptğ‘¤â„³ğµ2\displaystyle\leq\frac{8\alpha}{\eta}e^{-\eta t}d(w,\mathcal{M}\cap B)^{2}.â‰¤ divide start_ARG 8 italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_Î· italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

In particular, for a sufficiently large tğ‘¡titalic_t, dâ¢(Ï•â¢(w,t),â„³âˆ©B)â‰¤kâ¢dâ¢(w,â„³âˆ©B)ğ‘‘italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡â„³ğµğ‘˜ğ‘‘ğ‘¤â„³ğµd(\phi(w,t),\mathcal{M}\cap B)\leq kd(w,\mathcal{M}\cap B)italic_d ( italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t ) , caligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B ) â‰¤ italic_k italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B ) for some k<1ğ‘˜1k<1italic_k < 1. Then taking Uâ¢(B)=â‹ƒxâˆˆâ„³âˆ©BBâ¢(x,Î´â¢(x))ğ‘ˆğµsubscriptğ‘¥â„³ğµğµğ‘¥ğ›¿ğ‘¥U(B)=\bigcup_{x\in\mathcal{M}\cap B}B(x,\delta(x))italic_U ( italic_B ) = â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x âˆˆ caligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_x , italic_Î´ ( italic_x ) ), â„³âˆ©Bâ„³ğµ\mathcal{M}\cap Bcaligraphic_M âˆ© italic_B is geometrically stable for f:wâ†¦Ï•â¢(w,t):ğ‘“maps-toğ‘¤italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡f:w\mapsto\phi(w,t)italic_f : italic_w â†¦ italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t ).

Additionally thanks to our previous remark, Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U is invariant by fğ‘“fitalic_f. We can now apply Falconer [1983, Lemma 6.2 and Theorem 5.1], which implies that Î¦Î¦\Phiroman_Î¦ is ğ’2superscriptğ’2\mathcal{C}^{2}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on Uâ¢(B)ğ‘ˆğµU(B)italic_U ( italic_B ). âˆ

B.2 Minimality of Fğ¹Fitalic_F on neighbourhood

Lemma 5.

Consider AssumptionsÂ 1 andÂ 2. Let Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U be an open neighbourhood of â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M such that Î¦Î¦\Phiroman_Î¦ is continuous on Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U, then necessarily for any wâˆˆUâˆ–â„³ğ‘¤ğ‘ˆâ„³w\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w âˆˆ italic_U âˆ– caligraphic_M, Fâ¢(w)=supxâˆˆâ„³Fâ¢(x)ğ¹ğ‘¤subscriptsupremumğ‘¥â„³ğ¹ğ‘¥F(w)=\sup_{x\in\mathcal{M}}F(x)italic_F ( italic_w ) = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x âˆˆ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_x ).

Proof.

By definition of â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M, Fğ¹Fitalic_F is constant on â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M so that supxâˆˆâ„³Fâ¢(x)=infxâˆˆâ„³Fâ¢(x)=Fâ‹†subscriptsupremumğ‘¥â„³ğ¹ğ‘¥subscriptinfimumğ‘¥â„³ğ¹ğ‘¥superscriptğ¹â‹†\sup_{x\in\mathcal{M}}F(x)=\inf_{x\in\mathcal{M}}F(x)=F^{\star}roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x âˆˆ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_x ) = roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x âˆˆ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_x ) = italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Moreover Î¦â¢(â„³)=â„³Î¦â„³â„³\Phi(\mathcal{M})=\mathcal{M}roman_Î¦ ( caligraphic_M ) = caligraphic_M and by continuity, Î¦â¢(U)âŠ‚â„³Î¦ğ‘ˆâ„³\Phi(U)\subset\mathcal{M}roman_Î¦ ( italic_U ) âŠ‚ caligraphic_M.

For any wâˆˆUâˆ–â„³ğ‘¤ğ‘ˆâ„³w\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w âˆˆ italic_U âˆ– caligraphic_M, note that

wâˆ’Î¦â¢(w)=âˆ’âˆ«0âˆâˆ‡Fâ¢(Ï•â¢(w,t))â¢dt,ğ‘¤Î¦ğ‘¤superscriptsubscript0âˆ‡ğ¹italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡differential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle w-\Phi(w)=-\int_{0}^{\infty}\nabla F(\phi(w,t))\mathrm{d}t,italic_w - roman_Î¦ ( italic_w ) = - âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) roman_d italic_t ,
Fâ¢(w)âˆ’Fâ‹†=Fâ¢(Ï•â¢(w,0))âˆ’Fâ¢(Î¦â¢(w))=âˆ’âˆ«0âˆâ€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(Ï•â¢(w,t))â€–2â¢dt.ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†ğ¹italic-Ï•ğ‘¤0ğ¹Î¦ğ‘¤superscriptsubscript0superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡2differential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle F(w)-F^{\star}=F(\phi(w,0))-F(\Phi(w))=-\int_{0}^{\infty}\|% \nabla F(\phi(w,t))\|^{2}\mathrm{d}t.italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_Ï• ( italic_w , 0 ) ) - italic_F ( roman_Î¦ ( italic_w ) ) = - âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_d italic_t .

The first equality is the definition of Î¦â¢(w)Î¦ğ‘¤\Phi(w)roman_Î¦ ( italic_w ), while the second comes from deriving over time the function tâ†¦Fâ¢(Ï•â¢(w,t))maps-toğ‘¡ğ¹italic-Ï•ğ‘¤ğ‘¡t\mapsto F(\phi(w,t))italic_t â†¦ italic_F ( italic_Ï• ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) and noting that Î¦â¢(w)âˆˆâ„³Î¦ğ‘¤â„³\Phi(w)\in\mathcal{M}roman_Î¦ ( italic_w ) âˆˆ caligraphic_M.

In particular, for any wâˆˆUâˆ–â„³ğ‘¤ğ‘ˆâ„³w\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w âˆˆ italic_U âˆ– caligraphic_M, wâˆ’Î¦â¢(w)â‰ 0ğ‘¤Î¦ğ‘¤0w-\Phi(w)\neq 0italic_w - roman_Î¦ ( italic_w ) â‰  0, so that the second integral is also non-zero. In particular, Fâ¢(w)>Fâ‹†ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†F(w)>F^{\star}italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for any wâˆˆUâˆ–â„³ğ‘¤ğ‘ˆâ„³w\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w âˆˆ italic_U âˆ– caligraphic_M. âˆ

B.3 Alternative equation for w~âˆ˜superscript~ğ‘¤\tilde{w}^{\circ}over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

Lemma 6.

If AssumptionÂ 2 holds, the unique solution of EquationÂ 6 also corresponds to the unique solution of the following equation:

w~Ë™âˆ˜â¢(t)=âˆ’Dâ¢Î¦w~âˆ˜â¢(t)â¢(w~âˆ˜â¢(t))Â andÂ w~âˆ˜â¢(0)=Î¦â¢(w0).formulae-sequencesuperscriptË™~ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ·subscriptÎ¦superscript~ğ‘¤ğ‘¡superscript~ğ‘¤ğ‘¡Â andÂ superscript~ğ‘¤0Î¦subscriptğ‘¤0\dot{\tilde{w}}^{\circ}(t)=-D\Phi_{\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)}(\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t))% \quad\text{ and }\quad\tilde{w}^{\circ}(0)=\Phi(w_{0}).overË™ start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = - italic_D roman_Î¦ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) and over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ˜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) = roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .
Proof.

This is a direct consequence of the two following equalities for any wâˆˆâ„³ğ‘¤â„³w\in\mathcal{M}italic_w âˆˆ caligraphic_M:

gradâ„³â¢â„“2â¢(w)subscriptgradâ„³subscriptâ„“2ğ‘¤\displaystyle\mathrm{grad}_{\mathcal{M}}\ \ell_{2}(w)roman_grad start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) =PKerâ¢(âˆ‡2Fâ¢(w))â¢(w)absentsubscriptğ‘ƒKersuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ¹ğ‘¤ğ‘¤\displaystyle=P_{\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w))}(w)= italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ker ( âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w )
=Dâ¢Î¦wâ¢(w).absentğ·subscriptÎ¦ğ‘¤ğ‘¤\displaystyle=D\Phi_{w}(w).= italic_D roman_Î¦ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) .

The first one is a consequence of the definition of the Riemannian gradient and the fact that Tâ„³â¢(w)=Kerâ¢(âˆ‡2Fâ¢(w))subscriptğ‘‡â„³ğ‘¤Kersuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ¹ğ‘¤T_{\mathcal{M}}(w)=\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w))italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) = roman_Ker ( âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) ) [see e.g., Boumal, 2023, Theorem 3.15 with âˆ‡Fâˆ‡ğ¹\nabla Fâˆ‡ italic_F being the local defining function of â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M]. The second one is given by Li etÂ al. [2021, Lemma 4.3]. âˆ

B.4 Bounding the trajectories

Lemma 7.

If AssumptionsÂ 1 andÂ 2 hold, there exists a compact Kğ¾Kitalic_K of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for any Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0 and tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0italic_t â‰¥ 0, wÎ»â¢(t)âˆˆKsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ¾w^{\lambda}(t)\in Kitalic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆˆ italic_K.
In particular, limtâ†’âˆwÎ»â¢(t)subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) exists for any Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0.

Proof.

Similarly to the proof of LemmaÂ 1, we can consider a neighbourhood Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U of â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M where the PL inequality holds:

â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(w)â€–22â‰¥Î·â¢(Fâ¢(w)âˆ’Fâ‹†)âˆ€wâˆˆU.formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹ğ‘¤22ğœ‚ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†for-allğ‘¤ğ‘ˆ\|\nabla F(w)\|_{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w)-F^{\star})\quad\forall w\in U.âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î· ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ€ italic_w âˆˆ italic_U .

Additionally, we can consider Î´>0ğ›¿0\delta>0italic_Î´ > 0 such that Bâ¢(Î¦â¢(w0),Î´)âŠ‚UğµÎ¦subscriptğ‘¤0ğ›¿ğ‘ˆB(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)\subset Uitalic_B ( roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_Î´ ) âŠ‚ italic_U and

â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(w)â€–2â‰¤Î²â¢Fâ¢(w)âˆ’Fâ‹†for anyÂ â¢wâˆˆBâ¢(Î¦â¢(w0),Î´).formulae-sequencesubscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹ğ‘¤2ğ›½ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†for anyÂ ğ‘¤ğµÎ¦subscriptğ‘¤0ğ›¿\|\nabla F(w)\|_{2}\leq\beta\sqrt{F(w)-F^{\star}}\quad\text{for any }w\in B(% \Phi(w_{0}),\delta).âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_Î² square-root start_ARG italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG for any italic_w âˆˆ italic_B ( roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_Î´ ) .

1) For some fixed Îµ>0ğœ€0\varepsilon>0italic_Îµ > 0, LemmaÂ 2 then implies there is a Î»â‹†>0superscriptğœ†â‹†0\lambda^{\star}>0italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 and times tâ¢(Î»)ğ‘¡ğœ†t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_Î» ) such that for any Î»âˆˆ(0,Î»â‹†)ğœ†0superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda\in(0,\lambda^{\star})italic_Î» âˆˆ ( 0 , italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) both hold

â€–wÎ»â¢(tâ¢(Î»)Î»)âˆ’Î¦â¢(w0)â€–<Î´2andFÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(tâ¢(Î»)Î»))âˆ’Fâ¢(Î¦â¢(w0))â‰¤Îµ.formulae-sequencenormsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†Î¦subscriptğ‘¤0ğ›¿2andsubscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†ğ¹Î¦subscriptğ‘¤0ğœ€\|w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})-\Phi(w_{0})\|<\frac{\delta}{2}\quad% \text{and}\quad F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}))-F(\Phi(w_% {0}))\leq\varepsilon.âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) - roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ < divide start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG and italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) ) - italic_F ( roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) â‰¤ italic_Îµ .

Moreover, the proof of LemmaÂ 2 also implies that there is some compact K1subscriptğ¾1K_{1}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for any Î»<Î»â‹†ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda<\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» < italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and tâ‰¤tâ¢(Î»)Î»ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†t\leq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_t â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG, wÎ»â¢(t)âˆˆK1superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡subscriptğ¾1w^{\lambda}(t)\in K_{1}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆˆ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

By continuity, TÎ»>tâ¢(Î»)Î»subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†T_{\lambda}>\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG. â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))â€–22â‰¥Î·â¢(Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))âˆ’Fâ‹†).superscriptsubscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡22ğœ‚ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ¹â‹†\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star}).âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î· ( italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

In particular, this allows to derive the following inequalities for any tâˆˆ[tâ¢(Î»)Î»,TÎ»)ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†t\in[\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},T_{\lambda})italic_t âˆˆ [ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ):

dâ¢FÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(t))dâ¢tdsubscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡dğ‘¡\displaystyle\frac{\mathrm{d}F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))}{\mathrm{d}t}divide start_ARG roman_d italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_d italic_t end_ARG =âˆ’â€–âˆ‡FÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(t))â€–22absentsuperscriptsubscriptnormâˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡22\displaystyle=-\|\nabla F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}^{2}= - âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
â‰¤âˆ’â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))â€–2+Î»â¢â€–wÎ»â¢(t)â€–2â¢â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))â€–2absentsuperscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡2ğœ†subscriptnormsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡2subscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq-\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|^{2}+\lambda\|w^{\lambda}(t)\|_{% 2}\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}â‰¤ - âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Î» âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
â‰¤âˆ’â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))â€–22+Î»â¢â€–wÎ»â¢(t)â€–â¢â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))â€–absentsuperscriptsubscriptnormâˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡22ğœ†normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡normâˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq-\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}^{2}+\lambda\|w^{\lambda}(t)% \|\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|â‰¤ - âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Î» âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) âˆ¥
â‰¤âˆ’Î·â¢(Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))âˆ’Fâ‹†)+Î»â¢R1absentğœ‚ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ¹â‹†ğœ†subscriptğ‘…1\displaystyle\leq-\eta(F(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star})+\lambda R_{1}â‰¤ - italic_Î· ( italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Î» italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
â‰¤âˆ’Î·â¢(FÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(t))âˆ’Fâ‹†)+Î»â¢(R1+Î·2â¢R2),absentğœ‚subscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ¹â‹†ğœ†subscriptğ‘…1ğœ‚2superscriptğ‘…2\displaystyle\leq-\eta(F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star})+\lambda(R_{1}+% \frac{\eta}{2}R^{2}),â‰¤ - italic_Î· ( italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Î» ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

where R1=supwâˆˆBâ¢(Î¦â¢(w0),Î´)â€–wâ€–â¢â€–âˆ‡Fâ¢(w)â€–subscriptğ‘…1subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğµÎ¦subscriptğ‘¤0ğ›¿normğ‘¤normâˆ‡ğ¹ğ‘¤R_{1}=\sup_{w\in B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)}\|w\|\|\nabla F(w)\|italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_B ( roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_Î´ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F ( italic_w ) âˆ¥ and R=supwâˆˆBâ¢(Î¦â¢(w0),Î´)â€–wâ€–ğ‘…subscriptsupremumğ‘¤ğµÎ¦subscriptğ‘¤0ğ›¿normğ‘¤R=\sup_{w\in B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)}\|w\|italic_R = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ italic_B ( roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_Î´ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_w âˆ¥. In particular, GrÃ¶nwall inequality implies that for any tâˆˆ[tâ¢(Î»)Î»,TÎ»)ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†t\in[\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},T_{\lambda})italic_t âˆˆ [ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

FÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(t))âˆ’Fâ‹†subscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ¹â‹†\displaystyle F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤(FÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(tâ¢(Î»)Î»))âˆ’Fâ‹†)â¢eâˆ’Î·â¢(tâˆ’tâ¢(Î»)Î»)+Î»â¢(R1Î·+12â¢R2)absentsubscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†superscriptğ¹â‹†superscriptğ‘’ğœ‚ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†subscriptğ‘…1ğœ‚12superscriptğ‘…2\displaystyle\leq\left(F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}))-F^% {\star}\right)e^{-\eta(t-\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})}+\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{% \eta}+\frac{1}{2}R^{2})â‰¤ ( italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_Î· ( italic_t - divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Î» ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
â‰¤Îµâ¢eâˆ’Î·â¢(tâˆ’tâ¢(Î»)Î»)+Î»â¢(R1Î·+12â¢R2).absentğœ€superscriptğ‘’ğœ‚ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†subscriptğ‘…1ğœ‚12superscriptğ‘…2\displaystyle\leq\varepsilon e^{-\eta(t-\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})}+\lambda(% \frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{1}{2}R^{2}).â‰¤ italic_Îµ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_Î· ( italic_t - divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Î» ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . (20)

Define tâ€²=minâ¡(tâ¢(Î»)Î»+âˆ’lnâ¡(Î»)Î·,TÎ»)superscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†ğœ‚subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†t^{\prime}=\min(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}+\frac{-\ln(\lambda)}{\eta},T_{% \lambda})italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_min ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG + divide start_ARG - roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Using EquationÂ 18 for any tâˆˆ(tâ¢(Î»)Î»,tâ€²]ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†superscriptğ‘¡â€²t\in(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},t^{\prime}]italic_t âˆˆ ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]:

â€–wÎ»â¢(t)âˆ’wÎ»â¢(tâ¢(Î»)Î»)â€–normsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†\displaystyle\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})\right\|âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) âˆ¥ â‰¤âˆ«tâ¢(Î»)Î»tâ€²â€–âˆ‡FÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(s))â€–â¢dsabsentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†superscriptğ‘¡â€²normâˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ differential-dğ‘ \displaystyle\leq\int_{\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}^{t^{\prime}}\|\nabla F_{% \lambda}(w^{\lambda}(s))\|\mathrm{d}sâ‰¤ âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) âˆ¥ roman_d italic_s
â‰¤Î²â¢âˆ«tâ¢(Î»)Î»tâ€²Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(s))âˆ’Fâ‹†â¢ds.absentğ›½superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†superscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘ superscriptğ¹â‹†differential-dğ‘ \displaystyle\leq\beta\int_{\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}^{t^{\prime}}\sqrt{F(w^% {\lambda}(s))-F^{\star}}\mathrm{d}s.â‰¤ italic_Î² âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT square-root start_ARG italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_d italic_s .

â‰¤Î²â¢Îµâ¢2Î·âˆ’Câ¢Î»â¢lnâ¡(Î»),absentğ›½ğœ€2ğœ‚ğ¶ğœ†ğœ†\displaystyle\leq\beta\sqrt{\varepsilon}\frac{2}{\eta}-C\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(% \lambda),â‰¤ italic_Î² square-root start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG - italic_C square-root start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) ,

3) Since tâ€²<TÎ»superscriptğ‘¡â€²subscriptğ‘‡ğœ†t^{\prime}<T_{\lambda}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, tâ€²=tâ¢(Î»)Î»+âˆ’lnâ¡(Î»)Î·superscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†ğœ‚t^{\prime}=\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}+\frac{-\ln(\lambda)}{\eta}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG + divide start_ARG - roman_ln ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG by definition and

FÎ»â¢(wÎ»â¢(tâ€²))â‰¤Fâ‹†+Î»â¢(R1Î·+12â¢R2+Îµ).subscriptğ¹ğœ†superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†superscriptğ‘¡â€²superscriptğ¹â‹†ğœ†subscriptğ‘…1ğœ‚12superscriptğ‘…2ğœ€F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t^{\prime}))\leq F^{\star}+\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+% \frac{1}{2}R^{2}+\varepsilon).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) â‰¤ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Î» ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Îµ ) .

(21)

Now define T~Î»=inf{tâ‰¥tâ¢(Î»)Î»âˆ£uÎ»â¢(t)âˆ‰U}subscript~ğ‘‡ğœ†infimumconditional-setğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ‘ˆ\tilde{T}_{\lambda}=\inf\left\{t\geq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}\mid u^{\lambda}% (t)\not\in U\right\}over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_inf { italic_t â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG âˆ£ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ‰ italic_U }. Since â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M minimizes Fğ¹Fitalic_F on Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U, EquationÂ 21 implies by continuity that for any tâˆˆ[tâ€²,T~Î»]ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¡â€²subscript~ğ‘‡ğœ†t\in[t^{\prime},\tilde{T}_{\lambda}]italic_t âˆˆ [ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]:

12â¢â€–wÎ»â¢(t)â€–2â‰¤R1Î·+12â¢R2+Îµ.12superscriptnormsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡2subscriptğ‘…1ğœ‚12superscriptğ‘…2ğœ€\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(t)\|^{2}\leq\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{1}{2}R^{2}+\varepsilon.divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Îµ .

In particular, for K2=Bâ¢(0,2â¢R1Î·+R2+3â¢Îµ)subscriptğ¾2ğµ02subscriptğ‘…1ğœ‚superscriptğ‘…23ğœ€K_{2}=B(0,\frac{2R_{1}}{\eta}+R^{2}+3\varepsilon)italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_B ( 0 , divide start_ARG 2 italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 3 italic_Îµ ) and any tâˆˆ[tâ€²,T~Î»]ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¡â€²subscript~ğ‘‡ğœ†t\in[t^{\prime},\tilde{T}_{\lambda}]italic_t âˆˆ [ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], wÎ»â¢(t)âˆˆK2superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡subscriptğ¾2w^{\lambda}(t)\in K_{2}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆˆ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. By continuity and compactness, infwâˆˆ(âˆ‚U)âˆ©K2Fâ¢(w)>Fâ‹†subscriptinfimumğ‘¤ğ‘ˆsubscriptğ¾2ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K_{2}}F(w)>F^{\star}roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ ( âˆ‚ italic_U ) âˆ© italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT thanks to LemmaÂ 5. Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t))<infwâˆˆ(âˆ‚U)âˆ©K2Fâ¢(w).ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡subscriptinfimumğ‘¤ğ‘ˆsubscriptğ¾2ğ¹ğ‘¤\displaystyle F(w^{\lambda}(t))<\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K_{2}}F(w).italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) < roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ ( âˆ‚ italic_U ) âˆ© italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) .

Assume now that T~Î»<âˆsubscript~ğ‘‡ğœ†\tilde{T}_{\lambda}<\inftyover~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < âˆ. In particular for any tâ‰¥tâ€²ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¡â€²t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t â‰¥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, wÎ»â¢(t)âˆˆK2superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡subscriptğ¾2w^{\lambda}(t)\in K_{2}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆˆ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.


To summarize, we have showed that there exists a small enough Î»â‹†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, such that for any Î»<Î»â‹†ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda<\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» < italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

  1. 1.

    wÎ»â¢(t)superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is included in some compact K1subscriptğ¾1K_{1}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for tâ‰¤tâ¢(Î»)Î»ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†t\leq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_t â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG;

  2. 2.

    wÎ»â¢(t)superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is included in Bâ¢(Î¦â¢(w0),Î´)ğµÎ¦subscriptğ‘¤0ğ›¿B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)italic_B ( roman_Î¦ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_Î´ ) or tâˆˆ(tâ¢(Î»)Î»,tâ€²)ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğœ†ğœ†superscriptğ‘¡â€²t\in(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},t^{\prime})italic_t âˆˆ ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_Î» ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT );

  3. 3.

    wÎ»â¢(t)superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is included in some compact K2subscriptğ¾2K_{2}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for tâ‰¥tâ€²ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¡â€²t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t â‰¥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT;

where K1subscriptğ¾1K_{1}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and K2subscriptğ¾2K_{2}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are both independent of Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î». In particular, there exists a compact Kğ¾Kitalic_K of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT independent of Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î» such that for any Î»â‰¤Î»â‹†ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» â‰¤ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, the trajectory of (wÎ»â¢(t))tâ‰¥0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ‘¡0(w^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â‰¥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is included in Kğ¾Kitalic_K.

For Î»â‰¥Î»â‹†ğœ†superscriptğœ†â‹†\lambda\geq\lambda^{\star}italic_Î» â‰¥ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we directly have by monotonicity of the objective that for any tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0italic_t â‰¥ 0

12â¢â€–wÎ»â¢(t)â€–212superscriptnormsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(t)\|^{2}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤12â¢â€–wÎ»â¢(0)â€–2+1Î»â¢(Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(0))âˆ’Fâ¢(wÎ»â¢(t)))absent12superscriptnormsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†021ğœ†ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†0ğ¹superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(0)\|^{2}+\frac{1}{\lambda}\left(F(w^% {\lambda}(0))-F(w^{\lambda}(t))\right)â‰¤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ( italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) - italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) )
â‰¤12âˆ¥wÎ»(0)âˆ¥2+1Î»â‹†F(wÎ»(0),\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(0)\|^{2}+\frac{1}{\lambda^{\star}}F(% w^{\lambda}(0),â‰¤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG âˆ¥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ,

so that the trajectory (wÎ»â¢(t))tâ‰¥0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ‘¡0(w^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â‰¥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is also included in a compact independent of Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î».

As a consequence, the definability assumption of FÎ»subscriptğ¹ğœ†F_{\lambda}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT along with the boundedness implies that limtâ†’âˆwÎ»â¢(t)subscriptâ†’ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¤ğœ†ğ‘¡\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) exists thanks to Kurdyka [1998, Theorem 2].

âˆ

B.5 Proof of LemmaÂ 3

See 3

Proof.

We consider the neighbourhood Uğ‘ˆUitalic_U defined as in LemmaÂ 7. By definition, Fğ¹Fitalic_F is constant on the manifold â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and denote its value Fâ‹†superscriptğ¹â‹†F^{\star}italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, i.e., Fâ‹†=supwâˆˆâ„³Fâ¢(w)=infwâˆˆâ„³Fâ¢(w)superscriptğ¹â‹†subscriptsupremumğ‘¤â„³ğ¹ğ‘¤subscriptinfimumğ‘¤â„³ğ¹ğ‘¤F^{\star}=\sup_{w\in\mathcal{M}}F(w)=\inf_{w\in\mathcal{M}}F(w)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) = roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ).

For any Îµ>0ğœ€0\varepsilon>0italic_Îµ > 0, we define UÎµsubscriptğ‘ˆğœ€U_{\varepsilon}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as UÎµ={wâˆˆUâˆ£Fâ¢(w)<Fâ‹†+Îµ}subscriptğ‘ˆğœ€conditional-setğ‘¤ğ‘ˆğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†ğœ€U_{\varepsilon}=\{w\in U\mid F(w)<F^{\star}+\varepsilon\}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_w âˆˆ italic_U âˆ£ italic_F ( italic_w ) < italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Îµ } and show that it satisfies these three conditions. By continuity of Fğ¹Fitalic_F, UÎµsubscriptğ‘ˆğœ€U_{\varepsilon}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a neighbourhood of â„³â„³\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and the first condition is obviously satisfied.

Thanks to LemmaÂ 5, for any wâˆˆUâˆ–â„³ğ‘¤ğ‘ˆâ„³w\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w âˆˆ italic_U âˆ– caligraphic_M, Fâ¢(w)>Fâ‹†ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†F(w)>F^{\star}italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. This implies the third condition,

â‹‚Îµ>0UÎµ=â„³.subscriptğœ€0subscriptğ‘ˆğœ€â„³\bigcap_{\varepsilon>0}U_{\varepsilon}=\mathcal{M}.â‹‚ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Îµ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_M .

The arguments of LemmaÂ 7 extend to any family of solutions (uÎ»)Î»>0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğœ†0(u^{\lambda})_{\lambda>0}( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying the assumptions of LemmaÂ 3. In consequence, we can consider a compact Kğ¾Kitalic_K of â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for any tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0italic_t â‰¥ 0 and Î»>0ğœ†0\lambda>0italic_Î» > 0, uÎ»â¢(t)âˆˆKsuperscriptğ‘¢ğœ†ğ‘¡ğ¾u^{\lambda}(t)\in Kitalic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) âˆˆ italic_K. From there, note again that infwâˆˆ(âˆ‚U)âˆ©KFâ¢(w)>Fâ‹†subscriptinfimumğ‘¤ğ‘ˆğ¾ğ¹ğ‘¤superscriptğ¹â‹†\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K}F(w)>F^{\star}roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ ( âˆ‚ italic_U ) âˆ© italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Since uÎ»â¢(0)â†’u0âˆˆâ„³â†’superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†0subscriptğ‘¢0â„³u^{\lambda}(0)\to u_{0}\in\mathcal{M}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) â†’ italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_M, we can then choose Î»â¢(Îµ)>0ğœ†ğœ€0\lambda(\varepsilon)>0italic_Î» ( italic_Îµ ) > 0 small enough, so that for any Î»âˆˆ(0,Î»â¢(Îµ)]ğœ†0ğœ†ğœ€\lambda\in(0,\lambda(\varepsilon)]italic_Î» âˆˆ ( 0 , italic_Î» ( italic_Îµ ) ],

Fâ¢(uÎ»â¢(0))+Î»2â¢â€–uÎ»â¢(0)â€–22<minâ¡(Fâ‹†+Îµ,infwâˆˆ(âˆ‚U)âˆ©KFâ¢(w)).ğ¹superscriptğ‘¢ğœ†0ğœ†2subscriptsuperscriptnormsuperscriptğ‘¢ğœ†022superscriptğ¹â‹†ğœ€subscriptinfimumğ‘¤ğ‘ˆğ¾ğ¹ğ‘¤F(u^{\lambda}(0))+\frac{\lambda}{2}\|u^{\lambda}(0)\|^{2}_{2}<\min(F^{\star}+% \varepsilon,\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K}F(w)).italic_F ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) + divide start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG âˆ¥ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < roman_min ( italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Îµ , roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w âˆˆ ( âˆ‚ italic_U ) âˆ© italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) ) .
